Football is 'like a dance' for Croatia's Modric - Kaká

Luka Modric makes football look easy and deserves the chance to lead Croatia into a World Cup final, according to former Real Madrid star Kaka.

Dance, dance, dance: Modric's football

Modric has rightly taken the plaudits throughout Croatia's run to their first final and was typically imperious during the semi-final victory over England.

Kaka spent one season with Modric at Madrid before leaving the LaLiga giants to rejoin AC Milan in 2013, and the ex-Brazil playmaker was full of praise for Los Blancos' "humble" number 10.

"Luka [Modric] shows us that it's easy to play. Believe me it's really really hard to play football," Kaka, speaking courtesy of Adidas, told Omnisport.

"To play the World Cup it's even harder. And he plays like it's normal. It's like a dance for him.

"And now he's this amazing player at a high level. Four Champions Leagues, a World Cup final and being the captain of his team.

"So it's really nice and he deserves that because he's a nice guy, always humble, so congratulations to Modric."

Chelsea's Courtois a step closer to joining Real Madrid

According to Het Laastle Nieuws, the operation to take the Belgian goalkeeper to the Santiago Bernabéu, and nearer his family, is in advanced stages.

Vinicius has arrived in Madrid

Real Madrid's new player touched down at Barajas airport on Saturday. He will be formally presented at the Santiago Bernabéu on Thursday afternoon.

Vinicius touched down in Madrid just after 14:30 hours local time this afternoon accompanied by his agent and a few friends. His arrival at Barajas prompted dozens of fans to show up at the airport where they waited to get their first glimpse of the new Real Madrid player. Vinicius signed his first autographs for fans but he didn't make any declarations to the media.

Presentation on Thursday

He will have the rest of today and tomorrow to acclimatize - on Monday he is due in Valdebebas for his first training session under Julen Lopetegui together with his new team mates. Vinicius will be formally presented as a Real Madrid player in the VIP lounge at the Santiago Bernabéu on Thursday at 13:00 CEST. For further details, click here.

Kylian Mbappe to Real Madrid: Sergio Ramos ‘stops’ Harry Kane signing and wants France ace

That’s according to reports in Spain that claim Sergio Ramos has vetoed the signing of the Spurs star.

Los Blancos are looking to strengthen their side after letting Cristiano Ronaldo leave in a £99m deal to Juventus.

And now Spanish outlet Don Balon, known for their bold and outlandish transfer claims, say Real captain Ramos has told bigwigs what he wants in terms of transfers.

The 32-year-old has reportedly made it clear he does not want Kane at the Bernabeu.

That’s despite the England striker winning the Golden Boot after scoring six goals at the World Cup this summer.

Ex-Real president Calderón: Selling Ronaldo was "a historic error”


Ex-president of Real Madrid, Ramon Calderón, spoke to AS at a Qatar 2022 celebration ceremony at the residence of the Qatari ambassador in Madrid, and said that Real Madrid had made a grave error in selling Cristiano Ronaldo to Juventus for 100 million euros.


“It’s very sad that they have sold a player like Cristiano Ronaldo, it’s a real pity. With what it cost me to sign him, the effort that we made to bring him to Madrid…. Manchester (United) did not want to sell home and it was very difficult. And now they have sold him for 100 million euros. There isn’t a player who scores 60 goals a year for you and is worth to you 100 million euros,” Calderón told AS.

A historic error

Calderón stressed that the price paid for Ronaldo, was, in his opinion, incredibly low. "Selling Cristiano is not good news, either for 100 million or a billion. But it is true that we put a clause of a billion million euros to discourage those interested in him in the future, but at the same time, to show that there was no other player like him. It's a historic error,” he concluded.

Real Madrid's pre-season gets underway: De Tomás, Ødegaard, Vinicius... but no Coentrão


The 14 first team players who were not involved in the World Cup will undergo the standard medical revisions on the first day back at work in Valdebebas.

The summer holidays are at an end and the Real Madrid first team players who weren't at the World Cup in Russia will report back to work this morning for the first day of the pre-season. In total, 14 players were due to arrive in Valdebebas at 9am today to undergo the standard medical revisions. This evening, the players will be taken through their first training session under new coach Julen Lopetegui.

Lopetegui will have nine players who were part of Zidane's first team squad last season (Casilla, Luca Zidane, Vallejo, Theo, Marcos Llorente, Ceballos, Bale, Benzema and Mayoral), two new signings (Vinicius and goalkeeper Andriy Lunin) and the three players who have returned after spending last season out on loan - Ødegaard, Valverde and De Tomás.

But one player won't be turning up for the first day back at work - Fabio Coentrão. The Portuguese full-back has completed his loan at Sporting Clube and he still has one year to run on his contract with Real Madrid, but the club are trying to find an outlet for him as he doesn't not figure in Lopetegui's plans.
